etymologies: late 19th century: from modern Latin Colubridae (plural), from Latin coluber ‘snake’

definitions: a snake of a very large family (Colubridae) which includes the majority of harmless species, such as grass snakes and garter snakes. The few venomous species have grooved fangs in the rear of the upper jaw.
shortDefinitions: snake of very large family (Colubridae) which includes majority of harmless species
